channel.title: Help! Server won't run? It used to
channel.description: I used the server about 3-4 weeks ago and it worked fine. But I had to money to buy a vps so I stopped using it. But now when I run the Run in the source folder it just doesnt work... (On my Pc/VPS) If someone can help add me on skype. tristan.conlon

item.title: Help! Server won't run? It used to
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Again, I recommend using an IDE like eclipse. It compiles in program. Some people Prefer NetBeans as well. Both are better than using .bat files to run/compile when not needed.

It also helps to post your issue here. That way others with the same issue can find your thread in chance of a solution.

Read full topic

item.title: Help! Server won't run? It used to
item.dc:creator: @rite4dead rite4dead
item.description:
@rite4dead wrote:

I have a compiler error I fixed my main problem.
Could you add me on skype to help with the compiler, a lot of people tried helping on r-s but its still messed up lol.
If you can help, add my skype; tristan.conlon

Read full topic
item.source: Help! Server won't run? It used to

item.title: Help! Server won't run? It used to
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

rite4dead:

Whenever I click run it should normally open a control panel thats where I click “Start Server” and it launches the server then. When I click run a cmd will come up saying “Press any key to continue…” and then the CP opens but now the cmd comes up but the CP doesn’t.

Edit the .bat file and check to make sure the path to the main class (Whether it be server, Loader, the ControlPanel, etc) is correct.
Also edit the compiler .bat (if you have one) to make sure it’s compile path is set correct, along with the jdk path (if not using environmental variables).
Now recompile the server and run it again.

Another way to load it would be to get a IDE like Eclipse, and load the server in there. If your server is control panel based, and you don’t use the cmd for anything, you can always jar your server too. You just have to make sure all the save/load paths are correct.

Read full topic
item.source: Help! Server won't run? It used to

item.title: Help! Server won't run? It used to
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

Check to see if the Server Ip is set to local or is set accordingly to your VPS IP
